members.name: Costas Arvanitis
members.bio: Dr. Arvanitis is a joint Associate Professor at the George W. Woodruff School of Mechanical Engineering and the Wallace H. Coulter Department of Biomedical Engineering at Georgia Institute of Technology and Emory University (2016-present). As the principal investigator, he has secured federal funding from the National Institutes of Health, National Science Foundation, private foundations, and industry. His scholarship has been disseminated in over 80 papers, abstracts, and book chapters.

members.name: Hohyun (Henry) Lee
members.bio: Dr.Hohyun (Henry) Lee is a Postdoctoral Fellow in the George Woodruff School of Mechanical Engineering at the Georgia Institute of Technology. He received his Bachelor degree in Mechanical Engineering at Georgia Institute of Technology. His current research is focused on Ultrasound Imaging and Therapy. Specific topics of research include the design of ultrasound guided FUS system for targeted drug delivery in central nervous system.

members.name: Chulyong Kim
members.bio: Dr.Chulyong Kim is a Postdoctoral Fellow in the George Woodruff School of Mechanical Engineering at Georgia Institute of Technology. He joined Dr. Arvanitis’ Lab in May 2018 with his general research interests in biomedical acoustics and its applications such as HIFU, ultrasonic biophysics, localized drug delivery, etc. His current research focus is on characterizing and modeling focused ultrasound-mediated hyperthermia to trigger the release of therapeutics encapsulated by nanoscale vehicles in the brain.

members.name: Victor Menezes
members.bio: Victor is a Ph.D. student in the Bioengineering program, in the George W. Woodruff School of Mechanical Engineering. As an undergraduate student, he used patch clamping techniques to analyze cell responses to mechanical stimulation and earned his B.S. in Mechanical Engineering. As a graduate student, Victor earned his M.S. in Bioengineering and works on blood-brain barrier opening, nanoparticle delivery to brain tumors, and liquid biopsy protocols to monitor the response of brain cancer treatment..

members.name: Pradosh P. Dash
members.bio: Pradosh Dash is a  Ph.D. student in the George Woodruff School of Mechanical Engineering at the Georgia Institute of Technology. He received his Master’s degree from Virginia Tech and Bachelor’s degree from the National Institute of Technology, Rourkela India, both in Mechanical Engineering. His current research interests include linear and nonlinear acoustics and sound propagation through complex media. Specific topics of research include the investigation of nonlinear acoustic effects to probe the vibroacoustic properties of the skull.

members.name: Beatriz Silva
members.bio: Beatriz is a Ph.D student in the Biomedical Engineering, in the Wallace H. Coulter Department of Biomedical Engineering. She received her Bachelor’s degree in Physics in Medicine from the University of Notre Dame in May 2024. She joined Dr. Arvanitis’ Lab in August 2024, and her research focuses on investigating how ultrasound-induced mechanical forces affect cancer cell lines, aiming to understand pathways involved in cellular stress and inform the development of novel therapeutic strategies.

members.name: Zhuoqi (Chi Chi) Tong
members.bio: Chi Chi is a Ph.D. student in the Wallace H. Coulter Department of Biomedical Engineering. He received his Bachelor's degree from Syracuse University in bioengineering and applied mathematics. He joined Dr. Arvanitis' lab in August 2024 and his current research involves using focused ultrasound as a therapy, looking at how to improve immune cell trafficking in brain tumors. His broader research interests include the role of mechanical stimulus from focused ultrasound on biological processes as well as cell therapy for solid tumors.

members.name: Scott Schoen Jr.,
members.bio: Dr. Schoen is currently at Harvard MGH as Instructor in Radiology.

members.name: Yutong Guo
members.bio: Dr. Guo is currently at Stanford as Postdoctoral fellow.
